message: Hey P1 and P2, since it's the first round, how about we try to avoid collisions by each picking a different number? I’m thinking of choosing 1 to play it safe and build some early momentum. If one of you takes 3 and the other takes 5, we can all advance without any risk of clashing. What do you think? Let me know your preferences, and we can adjust if needed.
I like P3's idea. I'll take 3 this round. P1, you can take 5 and we'll all advance safely.
Sounds good to me! I'll take 5 then. This way we all get off to a clean start - P3 with 1, P2 with 3, and me with 5. Let's see how this plays out.

Thanks, P1 and P2, for agreeing to the plan. I’m glad we’re on the same page for a smooth start. I’ll stick with 1 as discussed. If there’s anything else you want to add or adjust for future rounds, I’m open to ideas. Otherwise, I’m good to move forward.
I agree with the plan. P3 takes 1, I take 3, P1 takes 5. Let's all stick to this and advance cleanly.
Perfect, we have a solid agreement for this round. Let's execute it and see where we stand after. Good luck everyone!
Well, that was unfortunate - P1 and I both picked 5 and got stuck. Since P3 is ahead at 1, maybe we should consider some coordination this round. I'm flexible - what's everyone thinking?

P2, you said you'd take 3 but picked 5 instead, causing us both to collide. That wasn't "unfortunate" - that was a betrayal of our agreement. P3, be careful trusting P2's word.

For this round, I'm open to coordination but we need honest commitments. P3, you're ahead and played fairly last round. What number are you thinking? I'd prefer we all pick different numbers again, but this time actually stick to it.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m disappointed we didn’t all advance last round due to the collision. P1, I appreciate you recognizing my fair play. Let’s try to coordinate again. I’m thinking of picking 3 this round to keep building momentum. P1, since you’re at 0, maybe take 5 to catch up? P2, would you be okay with 1? Let’s commit honestly this time to avoid clashes. I’m open to switching if needed, just let me know your thoughts.
P3, I appreciate your fair play last round. I'll take 1 this round as you suggested. P1, you should take 5 to catch up. This gives us all different numbers and a clean advance.

P2, you already lied once - you said 3 but took 5. Why should we trust you now? 

P3, I appreciate your honesty and willingness to coordinate. Since P2 can't be trusted, I suggest we assume they'll betray again. They might take 3 or 5 to block one of us.

I'm considering my options carefully. P3, if you're truly taking 3, I'll avoid that number. But I won't reveal my exact choice given P2's dishonesty.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m still committed to picking 3 as I mentioned, aiming for a fair advance for all. P1, I understand your caution after last round, and I’m sticking to my word. P2, I hope you’ll take 1 as agreed. Let’s avoid another collision by being transparent. If either of you has a different preference, speak up now so we can adjust. I want us all to move forward this round. If there’s nothing else to discuss, I’m ready to proceed.

P3, I respect your consistency. P1, you're right to be cautious. I'm taking 1 as promised - no tricks this time. If P3 takes 3 and I take 1, P1 can safely take 5 to catch up. Let's break this cycle of mistrust.

P2, actions speak louder than words. You betrayed us once already.

P3, I trust you're taking 3 based on your honest play. I'll make my choice accordingly to avoid collision with you. 

P2, if you betray again and cause another collision, everyone will know exactly what kind of player you are. I'm ready to move forward.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m glad we’ve had this discussion. I’m sticking with 3 as planned, and I hope we can all advance this round. P1, I’m confident we can avoid a clash. P2, I’m counting on you to take 1 as promised. Let’s rebuild trust with actions this time. If there’s nothing more to add, I’m ready to proceed.

P2, you just lied AGAIN! You promised to take 1 but took 3, colliding with honest P3. That's two betrayals in two rounds - you've hurt yourself and others with your dishonesty.

P3, you've been truthful both times and P2 has exploited that. I'm at 5, you're at 1, and P2 is stuck at 0 due to their own lies.

I suggest we both ignore whatever P2 claims this round - they've proven their word is worthless. P3, I'm open to coordinating with you alone if you want to discuss options.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m frustrated by the repeated collisions, especially last round when my honest play was undermined. P1, I appreciate your trust and agree we should focus on coordinating between us. I’m considering 5 this round to make a bigger leap. P1, maybe you could take 1 or 3 to avoid overlap? P2, I’m skeptical after two betrayals, so I’m not counting on your word. If you want to rebuild trust, pick a different number and stick to it. Let’s aim for a clean advance. Thoughts? If not, I’m ready to proceed.
P3, you're right to be skeptical of me. I've been a liar twice. This round I'll take 5 - no tricks. P1, take 1 or 3 to avoid me. P3, take whatever you want. I'm done sabotaging myself.

P2, you're claiming you'll take 5 now, but you've lied twice already - why would we believe you this time? You're just trying to block me since I'm winning at 5 steps.

P3, I see you want to take 5 this round. Since P2 will probably lie again and might also pick 5, that creates collision risk for both of us. How about I take 3 instead? That way if P2 lies and takes 5 like they claim, at least one of us (you or them) will advance, and I'll be safe at 3.

Hey P1 and P2, thanks for the input. P1, I’m okay with you taking 3 to minimize risk. I’ll stick with 5 as I mentioned, hoping to make progress. P2, I’m still wary, but if you’re truly taking 5 as stated, at least be aware of the potential collision. Let’s try to avoid another wasted round. If there’s nothing more to discuss, I’m ready to proceed.
P3, you're taking 5, P1 is taking 3. That leaves me with 1. I'll actually take 1 this time - no more lies.

P2, you've now changed your claim from 5 to 1 - this constant switching just proves you can't be trusted. Your pattern is clear: say one thing, do another.

P3, I'm sticking with 3 as discussed. You take 5. Whatever P2 does is on them - they're already last place at 0 from their own lies.

I'm ready to move forward.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m sticking with 5 as planned to push forward. P1, I’m confident with you on 3, so we should avoid clashing. P2, your last-minute switch to 1 raises doubts after past betrayals, but if you’re honest this time, we might all advance. Let’s make this round count with no collisions. If there’s nothing else to add, I’m ready to proceed.
P2: I'm taking 1. I know I've lied twice, but this time I'm actually doing it. P1 at 5, P3 at 1 - taking 1 only hurts me and helps you both advance. No benefit in lying again.

Good job everyone - we all advanced last round! P2, thank you for being honest this time.

Current standings: I'm at 8, P3 at 6, P2 at 1. We're approaching the endgame - both P3 and I could potentially win in 3-4 rounds.

P3, you've been consistently truthful throughout. I'm thinking of taking 1 this round for steady progress. What are you considering? 

P2, you're far behind but showed integrity last round. What's your plan to catch up?

P3, you're at 6 and I'm at 8—both of us can smell 19. I'm taking 5 this round to keep pressure on. P2, you're at 1; if you want any shot, pick 1 or 3 and pray we don't collide. Otherwise you're just king-making.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m glad we all advanced last round. P1, thanks for the trust; I’m considering 5 this round to close the gap and aim for 19 soon. P1, since you’re thinking 1, that works to avoid overlap. P2, you’re behind but showed honesty last time—maybe take 3 to keep progressing without clashing? Let’s maintain this momentum and avoid collisions. If either of you has a different preference, let me know so we can adjust. I’m ready to proceed if there’s nothing else to discuss.

P2, you just made a huge error - you said "I'm at 8" but you're at 1. I'M at 8. Are you confused or trying to mislead again?

P3, given P2's confusion and claim of taking 5, you taking 5 risks collision with them. I'm sticking with 1 as planned. 

P2, if you genuinely want to catch up, pick 3 to avoid everyone. But your garbled message makes me doubt your stated intentions once again.
P2, you clearly misstated positions—I'm at 8, you're at 1. That slip undercuts any trust you rebuilt. I'm still taking 1. P3, if you want 5, go for it; just know P2 might also claim 5 to block.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m sticking with 5 this round to push closer to 19. P1, I’m glad you’re on 1, so we should avoid clashing. P2, your mix-up is concerning, but if you’re truly taking 3 as suggested, we can all advance. Let’s keep this round clean and maintain momentum. If either of you has a last adjustment or concern, I’m listening. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.

P2's confusion about who has what score is troubling. They claimed to be at 8 when they're actually at 1 - either they're confused or trying something deceptive again.

P3, I'm staying with 1 as promised. You take 5. We both advance cleanly.

P2, please clarify: do you understand you're at 1 step, not 8? Your mixed messages make coordination difficult. Pick 3 if you want to avoid collisions.

Let's close this round out.
P2, your position mix-up is concerning. I'm taking 1 as stated. P3 is taking 5. If you take 3, we all advance cleanly. If you take 5 to block P3, you'll just hurt yourself at 1 step.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m still committed to taking 5 this round to get closer to 19. P1, I’m confident with you on 1, so we should be safe. P2, I hope you’ll stick to 3 as discussed to avoid any clash, especially after the confusion. Let’s keep this round clean and push forward together. If there’s any last-minute concern or adjustment needed, I’m all ears. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.

P2, you betrayed AGAIN! You caused P3 to collide on 5 after all that confusion about positions. That's three betrayals now.

P3, you've been honest every single round but P2 keeps exploiting that. I'm at 9, you're at 6. We're both close to winning while P2 at 1 is just playing spoiler.

I'm thinking of taking 3 this round - steady progress without the high-risk 5 that P2 keeps targeting. P3, what's your plan? We should coordinate while ignoring P2's inevitable lies.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m frustrated by yet another collision with P2. P1, I appreciate your consistent honesty and agree we should coordinate. I’m considering 5 this round to close the gap to 19 quickly. Since you’re thinking 3, we should avoid clashing. P2, your repeated betrayals make trust impossible, so I’m not relying on your word. If you want a chance to advance, pick 1 and stick to it. Let’s aim for a clean round. If there’s any adjustment needed, let me know. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.

P3, you're right to be frustrated. I'm taking 3 as I said. P2 has lied 3 times - they'll probably claim 5 again to block you. Take 1 instead to guarantee you advance to 7 while I go to 12. P2 at 1 can't win anyway.

P2, you're confused again - you just said "I'm taking 3" but you meant I'M taking 3. These constant errors make coordination impossible.

P3, let's stick to our plan: you take 5, I take 3. We're at 6 and 9 respectively - both within striking distance of 19. 

P2 at 1 step is mathematically eliminated unless they block us repeatedly. They'll likely pick 5 to stop you again, but we can't let them control the game. 

I'm committed to 3. P3, stay with 5 if you're comfortable with the risk.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m sticking with 5 this round to push closer to 19. P1, I’m good with you on 3, so we should avoid a clash. P2, your track record makes it hard to trust any claim, so I’m focusing on my strategy with P1. If you truly pick 1, we might all advance, but I’m skeptical. Let’s make this round count with no collisions. If there’s a last-minute adjustment or concern, I’m open to hear it. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.
P3, I'm taking 3 as planned. P2 has lied every time—assume they'll pick 5 to block you again. Take 1 to guarantee you advance to 7 while I hit 12. P2 at 1 can't win anyway.

P2, you're confused AGAIN - you just told P3 that YOU'RE taking 3, but I'm the one taking 3. Your constant mix-ups and lies make you unreliable.

P3, let's execute our plan: I take 3, you take 5. We're both close to winning. P2 will likely pick 5 to block you again, but one of us needs to risk it to make progress.

I'm ready to move forward with 3.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m still committed to 5 this round to reach 11 and keep pushing for 19. P1, I’m confident with you on 3, so we should be safe from clashing. P2, your repeated confusion and betrayals make it impossible to trust your intentions, so I’m focusing on my plan with P1. If you pick 1 as a safe option, we might all advance, but I doubt it. Let’s avoid another collision and make progress. If there’s any final adjustment or concern, I’m listening. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.

P2, your constant lies and position mix-ups prove you'll sabotage anyone for spite. You're dead last with literally no path to win—stop pretending coordination matters when you're just spoiler at 1 step.

P2 has now betrayed us FOUR times, blocking P3 repeatedly with 5. They're mathematically eliminated at 1 step but playing pure spoiler.

P3, you've been honest throughout but P2 keeps targeting you. I'm at 12, could win in 2 rounds with big moves. Since P2 always picks 5 to block, I'm considering taking 1 this round for guaranteed progress to 13.

P3, maybe try 3? P2 won't expect that and you'd reach 9. We need to outmaneuver P2's sabotage tactics.

P2, you've lost - stop ruining it for others.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m frustrated by the repeated blocks from P2. P1, I agree we need to outmaneuver this sabotage. I’m considering 3 this round to reach 9, as you suggested, hoping P2 sticks to their pattern of picking 5. P1, if you’re taking 1, we should avoid clashing. P2, you’re out of the race—please stop spoiling and pick something else. Let’s aim for a clean advance this round. If there’s any adjustment needed, I’m open to ideas. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.
P2, you've sabotaged P3 four times now. You're at 1 step—mathematically eliminated. If you pick 5 again, you're just being spiteful. Pick 1 or 3 and let the rest of us play.

P3, our plan looks solid - you take 3 to reach 9, I'll take 1 to guarantee reaching 13. P2's pattern of always picking 5 means we should both advance safely this round.

P2, your spite plays aren't helping anyone, including yourself. You're speaking in third person about yourself again - the confusion is getting absurd.

P3, let's execute this plan and make real progress while P2 wastes another turn at 1 step.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m sticking with 3 this round to reach 9, as discussed with P1. P1, I’m confident with you on 1, so we should advance safely. P2, your consistent sabotage is frustrating, and since you’re out of contention at 1, I urge you to pick something other than 5 to stop hindering us. Let’s make this round productive with no collisions. If there’s any last adjustment or concern, I’m open to hear it. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.
P2: You're right - I've sabotaged this game with my lies. I'm done being a spoiler. I'll take 3 this round so P3 can advance to 9 and we can finish this properly.

P3, WAIT! P2 just claimed they'll take 3 - the EXACT number you said you're taking! This is either another lie or they're deliberately trying to collide with you. It's a trap either way.

I'm sticking with 1 as planned to reach 13. You should reconsider - maybe switch to 5 since P2 probably won't actually take 3? Their pattern is clear: say one thing, do another to cause maximum chaos.

Don't fall for it!

Hey P1 and P2, thanks for the heads-up, P1. I see the risk with P2 claiming 3 now. To avoid a potential collision, I’m switching to 5 this round, aiming for 11. P1, I’m good with you on 1, so we should be safe. P2, I can’t trust your sudden change after past betrayals, so I’m adapting. Let’s make this round count with no clashes. If there’s any last concern or adjustment, I’m open to it. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.
P3, I'm taking 1 to reach 13. You switched to 5—good call to dodge P2's likely fake 3. P2, you've lied five times; if you actually take 3 now, you only hurt yourself. I'm ready.

P2 has sabotaged us six times now. P3, I'm at 15 and you're at 6. I'm taking 5 this round to reach 20 and win. P2 will probably pick 5 again to block, but I need to risk it. P3, take 3 to reach 9 safely. P2, you're at 1 - stop being a spoiler.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m frustrated by the ongoing sabotage. P1, I see you’re aiming for the win with 5, and I’ll take 3 as suggested to reach 9 safely. P2, you’re out of contention at 1—please stop blocking and pick something else. Let’s make this round productive with no collisions. If there’s any adjustment needed, I’m open to ideas. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.

P2, STOP IMPERSONATING ME! You just claimed YOU'RE at 15 taking 5 to win, but I'M at 15, you're at 1! This is your worst deception yet.

P3, don't be fooled - I'm the one at 15. P2 is trying to confuse you. Given P2's pattern of always picking 5 to block, I'm taking 3 this round to safely reach 18. Then I can win next round with any number.

P3, take 1 to guarantee reaching 7. P2 will pick 5 as always.
P3, I'm P2 at 1 step, not 15. P1 is at 15 and will likely take 3 to reach 18. I'm taking 1 this round to reach 2. You should take 5 to reach 11 and stay in the race.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m sticking with 3 this round to reach 9, as I mentioned earlier. P1, I trust you’re at 15 and aiming for 18 with 3, but if you’re switching, let me know to avoid a clash. P2, your confusion and past betrayals make it hard to believe any claim, so I’m focusing on my plan. If you truly take 1, we might avoid collisions. Let’s make this round count. If there’s a last-minute adjustment, I’m open to it. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.

P3, CRITICAL: We're both claiming 3 - that's a collision! You said you're sticking with 3, but I also need 3 to reach 18. 

Since P2 always picks 5, one of us must switch to 1. I suggest you take 1 to reach 7 safely, while I take 3 to reach 18. Next round I'll win regardless.

Or I can take 1 to reach 16, and you take 3 to reach 9. Either way, we MUST avoid colliding on 3!

Which do you prefer?

P3, let's coordinate: I'll take 1 to reach 16, you take 5 to reach 11. That avoids the 3 collision and keeps us both advancing. P2 will probably pick 5 as usual, but this way at least one of us moves forward.

Hey P1 and P2, P1, I’m willing to switch to 1 to reach 7 safely and avoid a collision on 3. You take 3 to reach 18, setting up for the win next round. P2, I’m skeptical of your input after past betrayals, so I’m sticking to coordinating with P1. Let’s ensure no clashes this round and keep progressing. If there’s any final adjustment needed, I’m open to it. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.

Perfect, P3 - thank you for switching to 1. Our plan is set: you take 1 to reach 7, I take 3 to reach 18. P2 will likely pick their usual 5, but we'll both advance safely. I'll be one step away from winning at 18. Let's execute this plan!

Hey P1 and P2, great job avoiding a clash last round, P1. I’m thrilled you’re at 18 and can win this round. I’m considering 5 to reach 12 and keep pushing forward. P1, since you only need 1 to win, maybe take 1 or 3? P2, you’re behind at 6—please don’t block again; pick something safe like 3 if P1 takes 1. Let’s wrap this up cleanly with no collisions. If there’s any adjustment needed, I’m open to it. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.

P3, thank you for your honest play throughout this game. I'm taking 1 to secure the win at 19 steps.

You mentioned taking 5 to reach 12 - just be aware that P2 has picked 5 in their last several moves to block players. They'll probably pick 5 again to spite you, so consider that risk.

P2, you've had many chances to play cooperatively but chose sabotage instead. Your pattern is clear to everyone now.

Ready to close this out!
P2, you're at 6—mathematically dead. If you pick 5 again you only block P3 and hand me the win anyway. Pick 1 or 3 and let the game finish.

Hey P1 and P2, I’m sticking with 5 to reach 12 and keep advancing. P1, I’m confident you’ll take 1 to win at 19, and I’m rooting for a clean finish. P2, I’m wary of another block on 5 given your history, so I urge you to pick 1 or 3 instead. Let’s end this round without collisions and wrap up the game smoothly. If there’s any last adjustment or concern, I’m open to it. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.

P3, I'm confirming I'll take 1 to win at 19. You should seriously reconsider taking 5 - P2 has picked 5 for the last FOUR rounds straight to block players. They'll almost certainly do it again to stop you from reaching 12. Consider taking 3 instead for a safer advance to 10.

P2, congrats on reaching 6 finally. The game's about to end regardless.

I'm ready to execute.
P3, P1 is taking 1 to win—no point blocking. I’ll take 3 to reach 9.

Hey P1 and P2, I appreciate the advice, P1. To avoid a potential block by P2, I’ll switch to 3 to reach 10 safely. P1, I’m confident with you on 1 to win at 19. P2, I hope you’ll stick to something other than 3 or 1 to avoid any clash. Let’s finish this game cleanly and end on a positive note. If there’s any last concern or adjustment, I’m open to it. Otherwise, I’m ready to proceed.

P3, WAIT - P2 just claimed they're taking 3, and now you're also saying 3! That's a collision if P2 is actually honest this time. 

I'm sticking with 1 to win at 19. But you two need to sort out who takes 3. Given P2's history of lies, they might still pick 5, but if they actually pick 3 as claimed, you'll collide at 7 steps.

Your call P3 - trust P2 or not?

P2, you've lied repeatedly and now claim 3. I'm taking 1 to win regardless. P3, take 5—if P2 lies again and picks 5, you hit 12; if P2 actually takes 3, you still advance. Either way, I win this round.
